content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the requested function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            println(line)
            line = "$word"
        else
            line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    println(line) # print the last line
end
```

Here is an example usage:

```julia
str = "This is a test string that needs to be wrapped because it's too long. It will exceed the text width if not wrapped."
wrap_string(str, 15)
```

Output:

```
This is a test
string that
needs to be
wrapped because
it's too long.
It will exceed
the text width
if not wrapped.
```

In the function `wrap_string`, we split the input string into words and then for each word, check if appending it to the current line would result in a line that is wider than `text_width`. If so, print out the current line and start a new one with this word. Repeat until all words are processed. Then print the last remaining line. The resulting lines will be wrapped at `text_width` width.
